intro: Combretum exellii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that appear in clusters during the rainy season. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its bark is smooth and reddish-brown.
